text: Agdistis bifurcatus is a moth in the family Pterophoridae. It is known from Cape Verde, the Canary Islands, Morocco, Tunisia, the Selvagens Islands, Spain and Portugal. The larvae feed on Limonium species, including Limonium ferulaceum. ==References== Category:Agdistinae Category:Plume moths of Africa Category:Moths of Cape Verde Category:Moths of Africa Category:Moths of Europe Category:Fauna of the Canary Islands Category:Moths described in 1952
title: Agdistis bifurcatus
